name: writing-unit-tests-lab-1
description: 1. Run `npm install` to load project dependencies. 2. See the problems below for a description of what each function is supposed to do. Each problem has 2 to 6 examples which you will write the test cases for! For example, Problem 1 has six examples, so you should write six `expect` statements (one testing each example). Problem 2 has four examples, so you must write four `expect` statements for those examples.  3. For each problem, first write the unit tests in the `exercises.test.js` file. 4. Then, run `npm test` to ensure the test case you just wrote FAILS! This is because you have not written the code for the tests yet. 5. Once you've written the tests for a problem, implement your solution to the problem in `exercises.js` so that it passes all test cases before moving on to the next problem. 6. Repeat Steps 3 through 5 for each problem until you have finished all problems and all test cases are correctly written and are passing.
